title: IT Chapter Lead for Platform Asia (DevOps) – WB Tech FMGT, Singapore
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Business Function:

WB tech Financial Markets & Group Treasury is responsible for the IT environment that enables the most crucial commercial activities of ING: Trading, Risk Management, and Liquidity Management.
Platform I area delivers best in class highly specialized technology platform to FM&GT users while anticipating on future needs. It responsible for the reliability and stability of applications, connections and servers while making sure that all assets follow the IT Risk Minimum Standards.

Job description

ING is looking for an enthusiastic IT Chapter Lead responsible for leading DevOps Engineers in Singapore and would be part of global squad located in Amsterdam, and India within Platform I area in ING Financial Markets.
Your responsibility is to inspire and build up the right capabilities and competencies to individual chapter members, equip them with right skills, providing coaching, hiring, retention, performance reviews, guiding Engineers at different stages in their career, behavioral aspects and helping them with their career development and progression. You will support the squads by providing technical advice and guidance.
As an IT Chapter Lead, you are also a “doer”. Sixty percent of your time, you work as a squad engineer with one of designated squad and Forty percent of your time for Chapter duties. You use your seniority to maximize team performance.

Responsibilities:

Great people skills to build and manage cross functional team
Create a culture in which your chapter engineers take responsibility, help each other to be successful and always stay a step ahead
Our platform has a global user base of Ops Control in Manila and Europe, you are responsible for support, oversee and managing production incidents.
As part of a cross-border Squad you work in an Agile/Scrum way, on the backlog prioritized by a Product Owner, and you demo your features to other colleagues and the stakeholders.
Ability to constantly balance the pressure of (IT Risk within risk appetite) targets of the engineers you oversee and the quality of stories they deliver
Foster a continuous learning culture, create a drive for craftmanship and inspire chapter members to knowledge share and upskill each other.
Ensure that proper change management are followed to avoid impacting production.
Drive for effective problem management, ensure preventive and detective measures of the applications are identified and resolved through the backlog with communication/ dialogue with the Product Owner
Recruitment, development, retention, including career development for engineers in the Chapter.
You look for improvement opportunities on stability, security, user experience, and proactively/ constructive bring these suggestions to the Squad/ PO for implementation.
We expect you to be responsible and take ownership. Be open, honest, communicate clearly (in scrum ceremonies and outside) and most importantly be eager to learn and proactively improve, yourself, the chapter you oversee and the ecosystem around you.

Requirement

A University degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Minimum of 10 years of experience in development & application support role, including functional knowledge to support end users.
A customer focus, with the mindset to find and resolve root causes of incidents to structurally improve the customer experience.
IT Operation support experience, combined with analytical skills to identify root causes in workflows incidents (data, technical, functional).
Hands-on experience in Windows Server, SQL Server, C#.Net (and VBA) programming, web server configurations (IIS)
Exposure to CI/CD pipeline tools GIT, modern stack (Azure, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes etc), logstash, Prometheus, Grafana, Kibana, ServiceNow etc
Knowledge in Networking (including firewall, file transfers, etc.)
Experience in Agile / Scrum / DevOps methodologies
Strong Knowledge of Financial Market Products is a plus.
Experience or affinity with IT Risk & Security concepts
Great analytical skills and conceptual / architectural understanding, ability to learn new technical concepts fast.
A good team player, cross functional, enjoys interacting with people of all levels in a multicultural environment
Strong resilience, constructive and collaborative mindset
Willingness to continuously improve technical skills
Strong communication skills, in English

title: IT Support Engineer
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Interact with clients via phone, email or chats and provide concise written/verbal instructions.

Follow up with clients, ensuring their computer systems are functioning properly after troubleshooting.

Maintain procedural documents and reports.
Monitor and maintain computer networks, Configure operating systems.
Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve issues using customer input.
Learn and work with emerging technologies.
Follow standard procedures to resolve issues by connecting them to relevant internal departments.
Provide prompt, accurate feedback to customers.
Ensure proper documentation of all issues.
Prepare prompt, accurate reports.
Document technical knowledge in the knowledge database.
Train people on how to use different systems.
Monitor daily performance of technical systems.
Help companies deploy new software or hardware systems.

title: IT Talent Acquisition Specialist - SPCT
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Tech Recruiter to join our team. As a Tech Recruiter, you will be responsible for identifying, attracting, and hiring top talent in the technology industry. You will play a crucial role in building our technical teams and supporting our company's growth and success.

Responsibilities:
· Keeping abreast of talent market and implement effective sourcing strategies to identify qualified candidates for various technical roles.
· Collaborate with hiring managers to understand their technical requirements and create job descriptions that accurately reflect the role's responsibilities and qualifications.
· Utilize various sourcing channels, including online job boards, social media platforms, professional networks, and industry events, to attract passive candidates.
· Manage effective relationships with recruitment partners, ensuring robust and high-quality talent pipeline and successful delivery for on time hires for tech talents.
· Review resumes, conduct initial screenings, and interview candidates to assess their technical skills, experience, and cultural fit.
· Coordinate and schedule interviews, technical assessments, and follow-up meetings between candidates and hiring teams.
· Provide a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment process, ensuring timely communication and feedback.
· Conduct reference checks and background screenings to validate candidates' qualifications and employment history.
· Collaborate with related stakeholders to secure approval, prepare and extend job offers, and facilitate smooth onboarding process for new hires.
· Participate in projects for industry trends at different markets, gather local insights, and competitive intelligence to effectively compete for top technical talent.
· Track and analyze recruitment metrics to measure the effectiveness of sourcing strategies and identify areas for improvement.

Requirements:
· Bachelor's degree in a related field.
· Proven work experience as a Tech Recruiter or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced technology company.
· In-depth understanding of technical roles, skills, and qualifications in the technology industry.
· Familiarity with various sourcing techniques and tools.
· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships with candidates, hiring managers, 3rd party recruitment partners and team members.
· Ability to multitask and prioritize effectively in a dynamic recruitment environment.
· Knowledge of employment laws and regulations related to recruitment and selection.
· Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.
· Results-oriented mindset with a focus on meeting recruitment targets and objectives.
• Singaporean(s) Only

Coen Tay Zhi Xuan (R1989334)
Scientec Consulting Pte Ltd (ScienTec Personnel) -11C5781

title: Project Management Officer (IT / Bank) - Ref: MY
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Duties & Responsibilities:
• Develops software solutions by studying requirements and working closely with stakeholders and Finance Team.
• Implementation of SharePoint-based workflows
• Design, develop and maintain key components of the software suite using classic ASP, Microsoft .Net, and SharePoint Server 2019.
• Ongoing support for applications, designing, and customizing SharePoint solutions.
• Planning and implementing software version upgrade releases, troubleshooting, and debugging SharePoint sites.
• Establish a UI design framework, Dashboards, Establish user journeys, mock-ups, or clickable prototypes.
• Deliver Monthly budgeting related activities like, monthly accrual and monthly forecast submission to ensure no overspending, completion, and adherence to standard and governance.
• Track monthly actual spending for projects to facilitate budget monitoring and submission of forecasting and accrual by Project Managers.
• Lodge and register contract and issues MCR and PO
• Track and submit required Finance posting for chargeback and reversal.
• Ensure Project Managers or Technical Leads obtain the DOA in accordance to standard and governance to allow contract lodgement and budget spend.
• Lodge and register contract and issues MCR and PO
• Monitor assignment of resources to projects and track their work allocation through Teams.
• Monitor and patch any recovery gap reported.
• Maintain headcount, forecast, actual, contract tracking.

Requirements:
• 4+ years of experience in advanced SharePoint layout, design, maintenance, site implementations, and controls
• 5 – 8 years in project management, project delivery or PMO
• UI/UX Experience with SharePoint Online, including creating custom forms, tools, or reports with Power Apps, and creating workflows with Power Automate.
• Experience using BCS to connect external data sources such as Access and Excel, with working knowledge of SQL queries and stored procedures to analyze data from multiple sources, including some understanding of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) techniques and processes.
• Strong knowledge of PMO analyst, finance processes, risk and project management standards
• High proficiency with Microsoft suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel).
• Handle banking projects in the data analytics space in the past is an added advantage.
• Advance financial& business analysis skills
• Has keen attention to details with excellent analytical skills.
• Team player with good communication skills

Execute tasks related to project / change request / maintenance request
Ensure project documentation is done up in accordance to bank standards
Ensure appropriate standards and procedures are adhered to during the development process to support quality deliverables.
Troubleshoot, debug and provide production system support
Key Requirements
The ideal candidate will be a dependable and result oriented technology delivery manager who can comfortably work in a large development organization in a globally distributed, dynamic work environment that fosters diversity, teamwork, and collaboration. He/she should be passionate about Technology and have a mindset to be technically hands-on if needed. Well-versed in the latest trends, especially around disruptive technology, and proven record in execution. The ability to work and thrive in high pressure environment is essential. This role will report to the Application Development Team Lead for the technical delivery of strategic projects.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar domain. Related professional/technical qualification will be advantageous although not mandatory
At least 10 years’ delivery record in developing and delivering global / regional Cards solutions for a multi-national/regional company with annual budgetary responsibility
Strong technical/platform knowledge on 3D Secure application (e.g. 2C2P, Arcot), Cards API, Loyalty & rewards (e.g. One Empower app)
Hands-on experience in leading Cards Technology delivery (e.g. Loyalty & Rewards app, CACS)
At least 5 years of hands-on working experience in the following:
Java platform / J2EE and Java web container such as JBoss EAP, Tomcat, WebLogic
Oracle database with excellent SQL skills
Web servers such as Apache HTTP Server
IBM MQ / web services
ConnectDirect
Unix/Linux/Windows with shell programming experience
Continuous Integration / Continuous Development/Delivery (CI/CD) toolset - Bitbucket, Jenkins, Artifactory, Sonar, Veracode, JIRA and Confluence
Open Banking API development

title: IT Support
description:

title: Assistant Manager, IT
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Summary:
The Assistant IT Manager reports to the Director, Finance and Operation and assumes the critical role of being the gatekeeper for company data security measures and the linchpin for ensuring unwavering stability in the digital infrastructure. Responsible for overseeing day-to-day IT operations and support functions, this role involves managing helpdesk operations, evaluating technology needs, proposing upgrades, implementing IT policies, providing technical support, and vigilantly upholding data security measures.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
Supervise and support the helpdesk operations, ensuring timely and effective resolution of technical issues.
Collaborate with users and departments to gather resource requirements, proposing and implementing upgrades and solutions to enhance the IT infrastructure.
Evaluate the school's technology usage, computing needs, and system requirements. Recommend enhancements to hardware, software, and infrastructure.
Assist in the development, implementation, and documentation of new IT policies and processes.
Contribute to the preparation of laptops for new staff, teachers, and students. Perform software installations as required.
Provide technical assistance to administrative and academic staff, resolving hardware and software-related issues.
Administer, maintain, and oversee Google accounts for staff, teachers, and students. Ensure the integrity and accuracy of the directory information.
Offer vigilant technical support for the school's network infrastructure, ensuring seamless connectivity.
Log and manage support requests/incidents through email and logging systems.
Provide reliable assistance for IP phone systems, ensuring uninterrupted communication and system stability.
Participate in testing new hardware and software, focusing on security, stability, and recommending enhancements.
Proactively monitor network traffic, remote and local server status, bandwidth allocation, and perform regular backups to ensure stability and data security.
Perform initial troubleshooting of server and network issues, ensuring rapid problem resolution.
Coordinate and supervise the installation of IT equipment when required.
Maintain accurate records of all IT assets. Ensure alignment with Finance's asset list.
Request and evaluate quotations from vendors for IT-related purchases.
Provide standby technical support during examinations to ensure smooth IT operations.
Manage, supervise, and train new IT staff, fostering a culture of stability, security and high performance standards.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Supervisor.
Requirements
Diploma in Information Technology or Computer Science.
Proficient understanding of Google Workspace and Microsoft Office.
Familiarity with various devices including Chromebooks, Macbooks, iMacs, Apple TV, and Chromecast.
Basic diagnostic and troubleshooting skills for technical issues.
Ability to support PCs, printers, projectors, and IT peripherals setup and maintenance.
Knowledge of Firewall, DNS, DHCP, NTP, SMTP, FTP, Anti-Virus, and system monitoring setup and management.
Familiarity with Wintel Servers and virtualization technologies (advantageous).
Strong interpersonal skills and a collaborative team player.
Excellent communication skills for effective interaction within the team.
Meticulous attention to detail and focus on tasks.
